intro: Achyrospermum africanum, commonly known as the African blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
